items.content:
Answering the phone

  • Hello? (informal)
  • Thank you for calling Boyz Autobody. Jody speaking. How can I help you?
  • Doctor's office.

Introducing yourself

  • Hey George. It's Lisa calling. (informal)
  • Hello, this is Julie Madison calling.
  • Hi, it's Gerry from the dentist's office here.

Asking to speak with someone

  • Is Fred in? (informal)
  • Is Jackson there, please? (informal)
  • Can I talk to your sister? (informal)
  • May I speak with Mr. Green, please?
  • Would the doctor be in/available?

Connecting someone

  • Just a sec. I'll get him. (informal)
  • Hang on one second. (informal)
  • Please hold and I'll put you through to his office.
  • One moment please.

Making special requests

  • Could you please repeat that?
  • Would you mind spelling that for me?
  • Could you speak up a little please?
  • Can you speak a little slower please. My English isn't very strong.
  • Can you call me back? I think we have a bad connection.
  • Can you please hold for a minute? I have another call.

Taking a message for someone

  • Sammy's not in. Who's this? (informal)
  • I'm sorry, Lisa's not here at the moment. Can I ask who's calling?
  • I'm afraid he's stepped out. Would you like to leave a message?
  • He's on lunch right now.Who's calling please?
  • He's busy right now. Can you call again later?
  • I'll let him know you called.
  • I'll make sure she gets the message.

Confirming information

  • Okay, I've got it all down.
  • Let me repeat that just to make sure.
  • Did you say 555 Charles St.?
  • You said your name was John, right?
  • I'll make sure he gets the message.

Listen to the video and discuss with a classmate:
- Do you think lady is doing her job well? Why (not)?
- How could she do an even better job?

questions.label: Listen to the video and answer the questions

prompt.body:
1. What is the complaint about? (name two things)

2. What is the name of the guest? And what is her room number?

3. Who will bring the towel and the pillow?

4. What is missing from the room?

5. How can the guest get some milk?

values.value:
1. There are only two pillows, the towel is too small.
2. Wallace is in room 23.
3. Someone from the laungry room
4. clothes hangers 
5. she can order it through roomservice.

content.body:
1. There are only two pillows, the towel is too small.
2. Wallace is in room 23.
3. Someone from the laungry room
4. clothes hangers
5. she can order it through roomservice.

A: Reception, ?
B:
A: You have a complaint? . What seems to be the problem?
B:
A: there are only two pillows on your bed? Yes well, I can send you up another pillow if you'd like three. .
B:
A: Why do we have such small towels? Our towels are standard size miss… Sorry .
B:
A: And what's your room number miss Wallace?
B:
A: No I don't remember what room you're in miss Wallace, not , and the computer's switched off.
B:
A: it's just quicker if you tell me what room you're in. However I can always turn the computer back on.
B:
A: 23, thank you! I'll contact immediately, and have them bring you a larger and another pillow. Goodnight miss Wallace!
Now practice the conversation with a classmate!

values.value: Off the top of my head

content.body:
1. Als je op je stage bent en je de telefoon opneemt?


2. Als je jezelf voorstelt als je een klant belt?


3. Als je Meneer Jones graag wilt spreken?


4. Als een klant vraagt om een van je collega's te spreken? En je ze door verbind.


5. Als een klant vraagt om een van je collega's, maar hij is er niet en je vraagt of je iets kunt doorgeven

6. Als je de klant wilt laten weten dat je het bericht door zult geven


7. Als je de klant niet goed verstaan hebt?


8. Als iemand erg snel spreekt?


9. Als je niet zeker weet of je iemand naam goed verstaan hebt.


10. Als je niet zeker weet of je een adres goed verstaan hebt.
I'll make sure he gets the message.
Please hold and I'll put you through to his office.
Hello, this is *my name* from Kuoni Travel.
Did you say 108 Cheapside?
Could you speak up a little please?
You said your name was Johnson, right?
Can you speak a little slower please?
Could I speak to Mr. Jones, please?
Thank you for calling Kuani Travel. How can I help you?
I'm afraid he's stepped out. Would you like to leave a message?

questions.label: Je loopt stage bij Kuoni Travel, in Londen. Wat zeg je:

header.title: Put the conversation in the right order

prompt.body: Please put the sentences in the right order:

content.body: A: I'm sorry mister Smith, but the doctor's schedule is completely booked for today. How about Monday at 11.00?
A: Good morning, Britsol Health care, How may I help you?
B: I have a really bad throat ache.
B: Well as soon as possible. Preferably today.
A: I'm sorry to hear that. Could I have your date of birth and your address please?
B: Hello this is Jim Smith speaking, I would like to make an appointment with doctor Green.
A: Thank you! And when would you like to come in?
B: No I'm afraid that's not possible. I have a very important meeting at work on Monday.
A: Hello Mister Smith, Why would you like to see the doctor?
B: 20<sup>th</sup> of April 1988 and my address is 49 Cornwallstreet.

prompt.body: Please put the sentences in the correct order:

content.body: A: See you then mister Smith!
A: Ok, let's see then. And how about Next Friday at 8.00?
A: I see, I'm sorry mister Smith I'm only trying to help.
A: Hm, Let me see if there's another doctor available.
B: I don't want to see another doctor!
A: Yes, doctor Green can see you Wednesday at 9.00.
B: That's a week from now! I really can't wait that long I can barely swallow!
B: Alright, that's perfect thank you very much. Wednesday at 9.00
B: Bye!
B: How about Wednesday, would that be possible?

items.content:
Maak de volgende opdrachten op papier.
Kies in ieder geval twee luisterfragmenten!

Je vind de luiserfragmenten hier:
A1. https://learnenglish.britishcouncil.org/skills/listening/a1-listening/a-voicemail-message
A2. https://learnenglish.britishcouncil.org/skills/listening/a2-listening/an-invitation-to-a-party
B1. https://learnenglish.britishcouncil.org/skills/listening/b1-listening/a-phone-call-from-a-customer
